flawed_nl_solution:
We know that Josh must be 30 years older than his age when they got married, therefore he is 30 + 22 = <<30+22=52>>52 years old today
If their current combined age is 5 times the age Josh was when they married (22), then their total combined age is 5 * 22 = <<5*22=110>>110 years
That means that Anna must be 110 - 52 = <<110-52=53>>53 years old today
If they married 30 years ago, Anna must have been 53 - 30 = <<53-30=23>>23 years old when they married

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 58, not 53. This appears to be a minor miscalculation.
